intro: Timonius oblanceolatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf timonius, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
